dublin_core.dcvalue: Randomized controlled trials that test the effectiveness of mobile health based weight loss programs are attractive to participants funders and researchers because of the low implementation cost minimal participant burden and the ability to recruit participants from longer distances Collecting weight data from geographically dispersed participants is a challenge Relying on participant self report is one approach to data collection but epidemiologic studies indicate that self reported anthropometric data may be inaccurate
Validation of self-reported weights and heights in the avoiding diabetes after pregnancy trial (ADAPT).
